results.title: [Orwell Michaelis Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Michaelis’s daughter, Sally Cohen, and her husband Sheldon Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This film shows an amateur game fishing trip that appears to take place in Bermagui. We see images of the pier with people boarding the small boats and preparing for the fishing trip. Once they set sail, we see seals on the rocks and dolphins swimming alongside the boat. The fishing expedition is a great success. A 250lb marlin is caught and brought on board. The catch of the day is taken back to the pier and admired by impressed onlookers. It is weighed, hung from a wooden scaffold, and put on public display. The flank of the fish is tattooed with the name of the fisherman, (R. Michaels), the marlin’s weight and the date of the catch – 6 February 1938. Various locals stop by and pose with the fish to have their photos taken. In the background are vintage cars and a Shell petrol pump alongside a general store which offers hardware, motor accessories and fishing tackle.

This film shows fashion, cars, buildings and amateur fishing boats. It is a snapshot of game fishing and all that it entails in Bermagui.

Selected Highlights List (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:01:00:00 fishing boats moored at a pier in what could be Bermagui; people board the boats in readiness for a fishing trip
00:08:00:00 people standing and walking along the pier; good details of the boats
00:25:00:00 two men organise equipment and provisions on the boat
00:48:00:00 a man is seen shooting film footage from a passing boat called Marlin
00:03:17:00 Orion passenger liner sails past the fishing boat
00:03:32:00 game fishing from boat, a marlin is hooked on the line and reeled in
00:03:43:00 fisherman reeling in the marlin
00:04:13:00 marlin is reeled in to the side of the boat and thrashes around in the water
00:04:24:00 the marlin is pulled on to the deck
00:05:33:00 the fishing boat arrives back at the pier
00:05:56:00 the marlin is winched onto the pier watched by onlookers
00:06:23:00 weighing the marlin on the pier
00:07:21:00 the marlin hangs from wooden hoist/scaffold showing handwritten sign on the flank of the marlin: 6/2/38 R. Michaelis 250lb Bermagui
00:07:44:00 a man stands and poses beside the hanging marlin
00:08:05:00 man stands beside hanging marlin in front of an old Shell petrol pump and Plume signage; General Hardware shop front advertising motor accessories and fishing tackle

results.title: [Orwell Michaelis Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Sheldon and Sally Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This film depicts scenes of Bali and Java taken while on a holiday in 1939. The film is divided into sections indicated by titles: ‘Native Law Court –The Ceiling is Decorated with Pictures of Punishments’; ‘A Balinese Beauty’; ‘A Temple Birthday Festival – The Procession’; ‘A Temple Birthday Festival – at the Temple’; ‘Polishing Rice’; ‘Cockfighting is a Popular Past time’; ‘Java’; ‘Java – Selecta-A Hill station above Soerabaja’; ‘Java Semarang’; ‘The Borobudur’; ‘A Mohammedan Funeral at Djockjakarta’; ‘Buitenzorg – Government House and the Botanical Gardens’.

This film is interesting for the Balinese and Javanese street, local transport and people scenes. Images of the architecture, temples, cultural traditions and ceremonies are also a highlight. The film shows pottery techniques and a pottery ware market. There is footage of a funeral procession and a traditional Balinese temple festival or Odalan. The film shows elaborate offerings of fruit and food which is brought with great ceremony by the locals to the temple. We see Borobudur and surrounds, including details of the temple walls and structure. Dutch spelling and place names, as well as images of the hill station resort Selecta, reflect Indonesia’s colonial history and provide context for the time in which the film was made.

Selected Highlights List (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:01:00 title: “Bali-Native Law Court– the Ceiling is Decorated with Pictures of Punishments”
00:00:16:00 images of the ceiling of what appears to be an outdoor law court depicting painted representations of Balinese punishments
00:00:40:00 women carrying baskets on their head walk down a palm-fringed dirt road
00:01:23:00 local woman works at a potter wheel making a bowl
00:01:46:00 local men walking down a road carrying a multitude of basket ware across their shoulders on their heads
00:01:54:00 pottery market
00:02:06:00 local woman tending to lotus flowers and garden; this is posed footage for the photographer and is titled “A Balinese Beauty”
00:02:32:00 title: “A temple birthday Festival – the procession” (or Odalan)
00:02:37:00 local people prepare for an Odalan procession
00:03:13:00 the procession of local women carry food and baskets and offerings on their head to the temple
00:03:55:00 tall elaborate offerings of fruit and food are carried in to temple
00:04:05:00 tall elaborate food offerings are carried on the heads of women descending the steps to the temple
00:04:14:00 black-and-white footage of elaborate food offerings being carried on the heads of women to the temple
00:05:29:00 colour footage of women carrying enormous baskets of produce on their heads
00:05:38:00 people polishing rice
00:06:27:00 a family and a dog walk down a rural road beside a rice paddy carrying baskets on their head
00:06:45:00 title: “Cockfighting is a popular past time”
00:06:46:00 cockfighting roosters in their baskets
00:07:00:00 cock owner shows off his rooster
00:07:09:00 old man and child with their cock
00:07:29:00 title: “Java Selecta – a Hill Station above Soerabaja” (Dutch spelling of Surabaya)
00:07:35:00 views from the Hill station look-out point
00:07:45:00 the manicured lawns of the Selecta resort with Dutch/Netherlands flag flying
00:07:57:00 scenes of the resort swimming pool and bathers
00:08:33:00 street scenes of Semarang showing bicycles, pedestrians, motor scooters, horses and carts, buildings and houses
00:08:50:00 buildings/houses with Chinese writing and balconies adorned with washing lines
00:09:01:00 school children on foot and bicycles travel along the road in front of what could be a school
00:09:17:00 colonial house perched on a hill in lush surroundings
00:09:23:00 Borobudur temple and surrounds, showing close-ups of temple details and statues
00:10:10:00 a group of children gather on the verandah of what could be a school
00:10:18:00 local women wash clothes in a river while children swim in the surrounding water
00:10:28:00 title: “A Mohammedan Funeral Procession at Djockjakarta” (Yogyakarta)
00:10:32:00 mourners attend a Muslin/Islamic funeral procession accompanying the coffin as it is carried along the street
00:10:48:00 bullocks and cart travel down a dirt road
00:10:53:00 title: “Buitenzorg – Government House and the Botanical Gardens”
00:10:59:00 Government House with pond and flamingos in the foreground

results.title: [Orwell Michaelis Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Michaelis’s daughter, Sally Cohen, and her husband Sheldon Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This film is titled’ Eastern Tour 1939’ and begins with footage of a passenger liner departing from Sydney Harbour farewelled by waving onlookers and streamers. We see Sydney Harbour and images of the Whitsundays along the way. The highlight of this film is the footage of Bali in 1939. We see Balinese people in a traditional canoe, juking or cadik, paddle alongside the ship as it arrives in Bali. Once on land, there are images of temples, rice terraces, farmers, and a Balinese market with traders plying their trade. There are local people buying food from the stallholders and busying themselves around the market and socialising. We witness a Balinese wedding ceremony and a Gamelan orchestra accompanying a performance of the Legong Dance. The film also shows dancers preparing and dressing for a Djanger Dance Performance, and a Kris dance is performed by men and children on a dirt road in Bali.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:00:10:00 passenger liner leaving Port of Sydney Harbour; onlookers farewelling passengers with streamers; Dalgety and Co Ltd sheds along the wharf
00:01:57:00 view from the deck of the liner of Balinese people in traditional canoe, juking, cadik  
00:02:47:00 Balinese market stalls
00:02:55:00 Balinese market crowded with local people
00:03:13:00 Balinese market stall holders trading
00:03:29:00 Balinese temple
00:03:44:00 Balinese farmer ploughs rice field with oxen
00:03:52:00 Balinese rice terrace with workers
00:04:15:00 old Balinese man stands in front of temple shrine
00:04:20:00 Balinese children and women crowd the steps of a temple
00:04:46:00 Balinese tourist guide interacts with Western tourists at a temple
00:05:01:00 two Balinese men stand overlooking a rice terrace
00:05:34:00 a Balinese wedding with wedding guests arriving on foot along a dirt road
00:05:42:00 wedding guests enter through a gate
00:05:50:00 the groom walks down the road towards the wedding
00:06:03:00 groom sits with the priest and receives blessings accompanied by various rituals and incense
00:06:32:00 Balinese man carrying a child on his hip
00:06:51:00 learning the Kris dance with Balinese men and children in the street
00:07:02:00 dirt road crowded with children and women
00:07:17:00 Gamelan Gong orchestra playing for the Legong Dance
00:07:43:00 Legong Dance Performance
00:08:52:00 women dressing and preparing for the Djanger Dance
00:09:00:00 Balinese children playing in the dirt
00:09:08:00 women preparing a dance performance – rubbing oil into their skin, putting on sarongs, wrapping fabric around their midriff
00:09:38:00 women dressing for the dance
00:09:59:00 musicians accompanying seated women dancers
00:10:07:00 seated men and women perform dance
00:10:29:00 a solo dancer enters the seated circle
00:10:46:00 dancers perform for Western tourists
00:10:54:00 masked dancer performs for Western tourists
00:11:26:00 dancer points bow and arrow at masked dancer

description_for_label:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Michaelis’s daughter, Sally Cohen, and her husband Sheldon Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This film is titled’ Eastern Tour 1939’ and begins with footage of a passenger liner departing from Sydney Harbour farewelled by waving onlookers and streamers. We see Sydney Harbour and images of the Whitsundays along the way. The highlight of this film is the footage of Bali in 1939. We see Balinese people in a traditional canoe, juking or cadik, paddle alongside the ship as it arrives in Bali. Once on land, there are images of temples, rice terraces, farmers, and a Balinese market with traders plying their trade. There are local people buying food from the stallholders and busying themselves around the market and socialising. We witness a Balinese wedding ceremony and a Gamelan orchestra accompanying a performance of the Legong Dance. The film also shows dancers preparing and dressing for a Djanger Dance Performance, and a Kris dance is performed by men and children on a dirt road in Bali.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

results.title: [Melbourne District Nursing Service Centre Openings]
results.brief_description:
The Royal District Nursing Service was founded in 1885 and was originally called the Melbourne District Nursing Service. An initiative led by the Reverend Charles Strong, the organisation was established to nurse the sick, poor and disadvantaged in their own homes. By the early 1920s the nurses were treating 25,000 patients per year and had established a convalescent institution, the After-Care Home (later Hospital) in Collingwood. In 1966 the organisation became the Royal District Nursing Service.

This film captures the opening of two Melbourne District Nursing Service centres in Melbourne in 1964 and 1965 and an event celebrating the renaming of the organisation to the Royal District Nursing Service in 1966. The film features great footage of 1960s nursing equipment, uniforms, fashions of the period, architecture and interiors of the centres and procedures for nursing visits.

The first ceremony takes place on 28th February 1964 and features an opening speech by Lady Delacombe, the wife of Sir Rohan Delacombe, Governor of Victoria. The camera focuses on several photographs on the walls of the centre - including the first two nurses of the MDNS, Nurse Ferguson and Nurse Cannon; nurses in Victorian era uniform on bicycles; and nurses in the 1920s wearing pith helmets with red Maltese cross.

The opening of the Footscray Centre takes place on 5th April 1965 and the proceedings are opened by the Minister for Health, R. W. Mack. The final section of film shows an event celebrating renaming the organisation the Royal District Nursing Service, in 1966.

results.title: [Orwell Michaelis Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Michaelis’s daughter, Sally Cohen, and her husband Sheldon Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This is a home movie from the Michaelis family of early Melbourne. ‘Australian Scenes’ is the title on screen and starts with a lovely view from the Yarra looking back to the city skyline. The river bank is packed as an exciting rowing regatta takes place. A great shot facing south from the top of Swanston Street and then the Shrine of Remembrance. We see a passing parade of Australian Army personnel in their slouch hats. A crowd on the steps of the Old Treasury Building. ‘Flemington, Cup Day, 1940’ is next with crowds of men in hats and wide shots of the running of the race and winners circle. A tennis match is played in front of a sold-out crowd in the ‘1946 Davis Cup Challenge’ at Kooyong’s tennis courts. A very scenic ‘Picnic at Warrandyte’ reflects a relaxing day out with the family in the country. There is footage of Australian native animals at what is possibly Healesville Sanctuary. ‘Bayside Scenes’ shows families enjoying the cooling waters of Port Phillip Bay. ‘Autumn at Macedon’ is a brief scene of trees in autumn colours. We then see the 1956 Olympic Games opening in Melbourne and the parade of athletes, releasing doves and the lighting of the flame. The film shows some events shot from the stands.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:35:00:00 rowing regatta on the Yarra
00:52:00:00 Melbourne street scene with vintage cars and tram #64. Facing south from the top end of Swanston Street.
00:59:00:00 St Kilda Road with Shrine of Remembrance in the distance; tram tracks and vintage cars
00:01:15:00 Shrine of Remembrance with people assembled on stairs
00:01:23:00 Melbourne Street scene, pedestrians and cars
00:01:28:00 possibly an Anzac Day march led by an army band and followed by soldiers
00:01:54:00 spectators crowd on the steps on the Old Treasury Building
00:02:06:00 Melbourne Cup Day, Flemington 1940. Punters crowd around the bookmakers – one being M. Labb
00:02:19:00 race horses being led around the mounting yard
00:02:47:00 footage of race (possibly the Melbourne Cup) shot from the grand stand
00:03:00:00 officials and jockey Andy Knox assemble for the cup presentation
00:03:07:00 1946 Davis Cup Challenge footage of Kooyong Centre Court and crowds in the grandstand
00:03:41:00 men’s singles match footage
00:03:51:00 men’s doubles match footage
00:04:29:00 close-up of the Davis Cup trophy with onlookers inspecting it
00:04:43:00 river in Warrandyte with swimmers on the bank
00:05:06:00 an old-style fireplace bush BBQ with chops and a billy boiling on the grill
00:05:10:00 close-up of a delicious looking BBQ’d lamb chop
00:05:13:00 family bush picnic in bucolic surrounds, eating picnic fare and sitting on blankets
00:05:23:00 rural scene with lake or dam and cabins with smoking chimneys and vintage cars parked around the cabins
00:08:46:00 Melbourne Olympic Games 1956 Opening Ceremony booklet or program
00:08:51:00 exterior of Melbourne Olympic stadium
00:09:09:00 interior of the Olympic stadium
00:09:40:00 atheletes enter the main stadium for the opening march and parade around the track
00:10:41:00 doves are released in to the stadium
00:10:48:00 Ron Clarke enters the stadium carrying the Olympic torch
00:10:58:00 shot of the Olympic cauldron alight with country flags in the background
00:11:26:00 track and field winners on podium

results.title: Maidenhead
results.brief_description: Maidenhead is a series of chamber-fictions inhabited by a young woman named Alice. Linked in an oblique, dream like way, these short, sharp stories describe Alice’s survival in an everyday world of bizarre logic and strange emotions. It’s a place where miracles unfold in the bathroom and desire appears on a bus; where menacing joggers roam the suburbs and there’s something sinister about hats. Vibrant like musical, Maidenhead is at once funny and disquieting, poignant and absurd.

results.title: [Shetland mills]
results.brief_description: Rare print (not titles/credits) of Shetland Mills woollen factory in Melbourne in the early 1950s. Title and print have been withdrawn and print should only be viewed on a Steenbeck. (HG 20/01/06) Looks at a modern knitting mill in Melbourne circa 1950. Shows headquaters near the corner of Lonsdale and Bourke streets; workers arriving for work; delivering the yarn; lunch in the cafeteria; and workers operating equipment.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 06]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Wonderful Lake Taupo and trout fishing. 2. North Island - Rotorua, geyserland, a volcano and skiing. Boating on the Wanganui River. 3. Perth, WA - Re-enactment of Fremantle and Stirling proclaiming Western Australian colony in 1829. Winter surfing at Cottesloe and country scenes. 4. The Empire Games in Sydney 1938 - track and field, swimming and diving, and rowing on the Nepean River.

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Swiss Society for Combating Cancer
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.
